DOC.brief_summary: The aim research ass whether Contingency Management effective improve treatment adherence substance use disorder ( SUD ) patient comorbid PTSD . Although Prolonged Exposure therapy ( PE ) gold standard treatment PTSD , study treatment substance user show poor adherence . Contingency Management well-established approach could use enhance adherence PE . From consented sample 125 opioid-dependent methadone-treated patient Addiction Treatment Services , intent-to-treat sample 62 patient co-occurring current PTSD offer PE . Half 62 participant randomly assign Prolonged Exposure Contingency Management ( PE+CM ) condition provide monetary-based incentive attend PE therapy session . The comparison condition assign Prolonged Exposure ( PE ) condition without attendance incentive intervention . The PE session schedule per week 12 week , 12-week follow-up . Groups compare primarily adherence PE schedule , improvement PTSD symptom , rate drug use ( urine specimen , self-reported use ) . The study 's three primary aim 1 ) Evaluate efficacy add voucher-based attendance incentive PE PTSD increase adherence SUD patient methadone treatment program ; 2 ) Evaluate efficacy add voucher-based attendance incentive PE PTSD reduce PTSD symptom SUD patient ; 3 ) Evaluate effect PE PTSD rate drug use SUD patient .
